alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 5:24PM CDT until April 15 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 523 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Union, Missouri, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...At 521 PM, law enforcement reported two inch hail in Union, Missouri. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Franklin County. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri near exit 251. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
